ygData.subject: Re: FAO Cronus
ygData.msgSnippet: ... *ahem* Everquest is at it s roots, an lpc mud. lpc muds are about hack and slash. Everquest is very nicely graphical, but I d hardly say that it demands,
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 6 Apr 1999, Steve Price wrote:

> From: "Steve Price" <silten@...>
>
> Thanks for the support Cronus.
>
> I believe EQ is custom made for RP, and it's difficult to see how it could
> survive without at least some RPers on each server.

*ahem*

Everquest is at it's roots, an lpc mud.
lpc muds are about hack and slash.
Everquest is very nicely graphical, but I'd hardly say that it demands, or
even encourages Roleplay.

To really encourage Roleplay, I'd say that you need a much more indepth
background system. Something to help define and differntiate your
character from every other Halas Barbarian Warrior or Freeport Monk.

This isn't to say that some roleplay isn't possible, or even enjoyable
when it does happen.
Merely that I continually fail to see why people continually say that
Everquest is 1)all about roleplaying 2)powergaming is a naughty word.


Dirque
<This space still for rent>
